climbs.name: What-A-Doo
climbs.fa: I. Altman, P. Nasca with CTA climbing class,  Dec. 2021

content.description: Climb face through two subtle overhangs following seven bolts. The anchor is located in line and is below the two routes to either side of it.
content.location:
It is located between

Rookie Hook

and

Psycho Billy Cadillac

.

content.description: This is a short route that climbs straight up past 6 bolts.
content.location: This is now the [fifth] route on the left end of the wall.

content.description: This is probably the best and most difficult in the main concentration of routes.
content.location: This is the [seventh] route from the left.

content.description: Start on a big, horizontal pocket that is a good jug. Follow pockets, crimps, and a few slopers either straight up the bolt line or sometimes trending left towards the undercling. If one uses features further left, it is 5.9ish, but if you stay direct on the bolt line, it is somewhere around 5.10.
content.protection: Bolts, all 3/8" stainless steel wedge bolts with 316 SS hangers, placed in some of the most solid rock on the cliff. There is clippable lowering hardware at the anchor.
content.location:
This is in between

The Undercling

and

Hoods in the Woods

. It ends in a prominent, left-facing dihedral. The first bolt is directly above a long, horizontal, pocket jug.

content.description: Climb up past 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [tenth] route from the left, three before the fence.

content.description: This is another decent moderate route near the center of the main concentration of climbs.
content.location: This is the [eighth] route from the left.

climbs.name: PWI
climbs.fa: Eli Poss, Ian Altman, Carl Schnitker

content.description: A one move wonder crux off the ground leads to a good stance. Follow bolts to the rat shit alcove, and pull over the bulge. 10 or so more feet take you to a ledge with the anchor. Don't steal the biners!
content.protection:
Bolts. It is bolted like

Beginner's Luck

at the start and

Misfits

at the end. Bring a short sling or long draw for the 4th bolt which is far to the right of the rest of the bolts.
content.location:
Between

Timberline Hang-Dogs (aka CTA Hang-Dogs)

and

Hoods in the Woods

, start on a crimper on a hollow flake below a pocket. A cheater rock may be necessary for people, like me, who have a short reach.

content.description: Climb up onto a small ledge, then through a small bulge.  Continue up passing 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [eighth] route from the right.

content.description: Climb up and left past five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [second] route on the left end of the wall.

content.description: Nice Jugs is surprisingly clean and solid!  The start can be hard if you don't get the sequence right.
content.protection:
This is well-protected with bolts painted black. It had biners at the lowering anchor when I climbed it.

Per

eli poss

: this has 5 bolts and two sets of bolted anchors.
content.location:
This is the route to the left of

The Undercling

.

content.description: This starts off of the ledge in the center of the wall. Climb past 7 [previously 4 bolts] to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [twelfth] route from the left, the last before the fence.

content.description: Climb straight up past six bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [sixth] route from the left of the wall.

climbs.name: Frisky Kitty
climbs.fa: I.Altman with L. Tronto and T. Woods

content.description:
This variation joins

Nine Lives

just before the anchor. Begin ten feet climber's left of

Nine Lives

, climb the steeper, pinkish rock, and clip five newer bolts before joining the very top of

Nine Lives

.
content.location:
It is just climber's left of

Nine Lives

and just right

Bad Math

.

content.description:
This route begins with a steeper section (5.8), but quickly eases off in angle to the anchor. It has solid rock if you PAY ATTENTION TO NOT USE THE HUGE, HANGING FLAKE to your right. This flake is large and hollow, but the climb can easily be done without using it.

The technical crux is at the first bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a 2 bolt chained anchor.
content.location:
It is located between "

Beginner's Luck

and

Misfits

."

content.description: It starts vertical and quickly eases.  I always see "youngins" on it, hence the name.
content.protection: Safely spaced bolts up to two cold shuts.
content.location:
This is the [third] route from the left.  It is right of

Nine Lives

.

content.description: Climb lower-angle rock past 9 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Originally this had 5 bolts, and with the update in Nov. 2020, it now has 9 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the [sixth] route from the right, second to last before the fence.

content.description:
I saw this route a week or so ago and wanted to come back to give it a try. It has nice and shiny bolts on it, which I think should've been painted to be discreet. There used to be an ugly plaque at the base with "5.10 c/d" scribbled into it. Disgusting. I am not sure what happened to it, but it's gone now.

Anyway, I got past the second bolt, which I would believe to be the crux, and stuck my hand in a big hole with a jug. A bunch of bees swarmed out, so I bailed back to the ground.

It looks like it could be a good route with fun movements. I just wanted to get it in the database, since many of the routes here are figured out by counting from the left, and there is now a new route, so everything must be moved down one.
content.protection:
Bolts.

Eds. there is now a new 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
As of 2013, this is the furthest left route at Fume Wall. The route has shiny, new bolts and is located just to the left of '

Nine Lives

'. It

now no longer

shares anchors with '

Nine Lives

'.
